data.title: ate there in October and 2 weeks later
data.text: Nada has a great selection of different items from pork belly and veggy and pot roast tacos to chips and salsa with 3 salsas ending with a habernaro called the creeper to pumpkin soup to fancy cuisine as well.  OUTSTANDING.  So good we ate there twice in our 2 week trip

data.title: Business Dinner
data.text:
Very good Mexican food. Pretty typical hipster Mexican. Definitely the authentic, super sized portions of your favorite Mexican joint. 

Tip - Go on a night when there isn't a show at the Aronoff. Not too crowded on week nights when no show.

data.title: Over priced but nice armosphere
data.text: I don't like when any Mexican restaurant charges for chips and salsa... also the $8 avocado dip was about as good as you get in the tubs at grocery store... very bland and small amount too.  Tacos if ordered a la cart are $6.50 each... they are worth $3.50-$4.  No combo plates on menu.  You want tacos, gotta get three of the same thing. The salsas and hot sauces are good. Bottom line. Mid range Mexican trying to be upscale and seems to be fooling a lot of patrons. Better to find a less "fusion/modern" Mexican place and save a few bucks on more authentic Mexican, but it's a nice atmosphere and food is not bad.

data.title: Expensive
data.text: I guess I am used to lower priced Mexican food, so I was quite disappointed when we had to pay for chips and salsa.  I also thought our food was very expensive.  Good, yet expensive.

data.title: Brunch at Nada is awesome
data.text: We enjoyed brunch on a Sunday afternoon at Nada.  We did not have reservations but we seated immediately out on their lovely patio. We shared our dishes and would have licked our plates had there not been other guests around.

data.title: Mexican casual
data.text: This is a great casual dining restaurant. Good food, good wine, beer on tap and signature cocktails. We have enjoyed every visit here.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: We had a very good dinner of upscale tacos and sangria. Our waitress was lovely, and very attentive to the food allergies of one of our guests.

data.title: Great Late Night Bite..
data.text:
After a night of some, well maybe a number of beverages, the need to be feed after 12am creeps up on all of us. We ate upstairs, which is kind of nice because they have huge windows that you can look out and onto the active corner that Nada is on. 
  The pork belly tacos, incredible. The mac n cheese, creamy, spicy, cheesy, so good!!  We also had the Mexican Poutine Eh..  Being Canadian anything that says poutine is a must have and was also delicious.  
  Loved this place and can't wait to go back!!!!

data.title: A good Mexican place in the Center of the downtown!
data.text: This is a place which I make sure to visit every time I travel to Cincinnati. Its location is great, just 5 mins walk from the fountain square in the downtown. They serve a good verity of Mexican food and their service is amazing. This place lights up beautiful well in the evening. I would highly recommend this place.

data.title: Service was amazing!
data.text: The service was fantastic, and the ambiance was good. However, the food seemed like they were trying too hard. It was good, but not as amazing as the menu and descriptions would lead you to believe.

data.title: Great for a light meal
data.text: We had just arrived and were staying at the Hilton so just a short walk. Seated outside on a very warm mid  October night and the place was packed which says something for its popularity in mid week. The waitress was great as we were not that hungry- her recommendation re the fish tacos and other dishes were spot on. The prices  of food and wine are not cheap but it was good for our first night in town.

data.title: Great Mexican Food & Atmosphere
data.text: Get reservations on weekends. This place was packed, and it was a tight fit. I had to fold up the stroller. You won't be able to order traditional beef tacos here. The baja fish tacos, the shrimp tacos, and the Sir Winston were excellent choices. The quesadillas were good but salty.

data.title: Good as always
data.text: The go-to-place for Tacos! Taco lunch box is of great value. Guaca is another highlight! Very good and fast services as well!

data.title: Sodium Galore though Vegan-friendly
data.text:
As an adventurous eater I love many ethnic cuisines, small bites, grazing, and exploring new tasted. Nada is in a fabulous location right in the heart of downtown Cincinnati, next to Aronoff Center so a convenient spot before a dance performance or concert. 
I, however, am highly sensitive to sodium. I've tried Nada twice, really wanting to like it - beyond the convenient location they have outdoor seating which I love - but unfortunately I haven't found any menu item, from guacamole to entrees, that I can tolerate. I usually just stop in for a drink and to people watch.

data.title: Pink grapefruit margarita
data.text: We started with the guacamole with chips and salsa. It was delicious, though the chips are small and fragile. Our basket had lots of very small pieces. My friend had the chicken enchiladas and I had the shrimp Tamal. Both were flavorful and nicely presented. We sat outside and the service was quick and friendly. We would go back.

data.title: Great place for a snack at the bar
data.text: We like to stop into Nada whenever we're in Cincinnati for a drink and some of their queso and guac. The staff is always friendly, and the food never disappoints. We've had other items on the menu and have liked everything we've tried, but the queso and chips are what bring us back.

data.title: Nada p adequate and possibly well named
data.text: We dined at Nada with friends and found it to be adequate. The appetizer portions were skimpy and the tacos (we had a variety) were good but did not warrant the price. The bar bill was higher than average but the service was 'energetic'. You have to go to downtown Cincinnati, find a place to park etc. The decor was dark with lots of hard surfaces thus the noise level gets quite high making conversation very difficult. If I happened to be downtown and looking for Mexican cuisine I'd probably try it again. For several couples to drive in from several locations as we did to spend the evening together ... wouldn't recommend it.

data.title: Great Mexican Choice
data.text: I had some Hispanic visitors and we chose Nada.  The visitors enjoyed talking to the server in Spanish and talking about their favorites.  One of the guests told of how a particular dish is served I'm Mexico and the sever was familiar with the style and told the chef.  My guests were really thrilled with the food and the service, great choice.

data.title: Great dinner
data.text: I have visited Nada numerous times and find the food and atmosphere to be very consistent and predictably great. I have enjoyed many of the selections on the menu and have always enjoy my experience at Nada.

data.title: Great food drinks and staff!
data.text: Not your ordinary Mexican fare. This was all good. Our hostess and wait staff were spot on . Margaritas ( top self) truly are worth the extra$ . Waiter was engaged and there when you wanted him. Nice light humor and solid information about what we were getting . Desert is a must to finish . You will not be disappointed. So smile and take people you enjoy .
